Issues.Title: $colors list in derived-variables are not consistent, partly list value, partly color value
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.
It is a question (and maybe kind of a bug or at least issue)?

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 1.0.0
It is not a **Sass** issue but an issue in the **Bulma Sass code**.
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**!

### Description

In the `derived-variables.scss` the definition of `$colors` is a merged color map that contains some initial list values like white, black, light and dark and some plain derived color values like text, primary, link etc.

This yields to a problem when looping over this `$colors` map to create further elements supporting all colors.

### Steps to Reproduce

Previously in Bulma version < 1.0 you could do the following to use all related color pairs:

```sass
  @each $name, $pair in $colors
    $color: nth($pair, 1)
    $color-invert: nth($pair, 2)
```

This breaks now since some `$colors` pair values are lists, some are not but plain color values. So the code above results to that error:

```
$n: Invalid index 2 for a list with 1 elements.
```  

### Expected behavior

The `$colors` map should consistently contain color pairs of their color and inverted color to loop over each color in the same way.

### Actual behavior

As described above the `$colors` map breaks the loop because inconsistent color pair values.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "$colors list in derived-variables are not consistent, partly list value, partly color value" (#3751)

Issues.Title: Disable automatic dark mode theming
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

I'm using Bulma **version** [^1.0.0]
My **browser** is:  Chrome 122.0.6261.129 / Win11

### Description
As bulma had not been updated in a while before the v1 release I created my own dark mode with a class on the body and different styles depending on it. As I upgraded from 0.9.4 -> 1.0.0 I could not find a way to opt-out of the automatically applied dark-mode theming and thus breaks my own styling for the dark mode. I also use an angular service to determine whether to apply the dark mode based on the users settings from the localstorage or if that hasn't been set it uses the clients OS settings.

This is how I used to check for my own applied dark mode now with updated css variables in Angular.

```css
body.dark :host .node {
    background-color: hsla(
        (var(--bulma-white-h)),
        (var(--bulma-white-s)),
            (var(--bulma-white-l)),
        0.3);
}
```

**Basically: can anyone tell me how to disable this feature until I find time to change my approach in the future?**


### Expected behavior
Do not apply the dark mode unless I explicitly set 
`class="theme-dark"` or  `data-theme="dark"` on the body of my project.

### Actual behavior

It automatically uses the media query --prefers-color-scheme and changes the styling.

This is my own dark-mode which is not perfect but is alright for the time being:
![image](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/15277745/b9272f1f-f0cf-4f9e-a1fc-1a63195f134f)

This is my dark-theme applied on top of the bulma --prefers-color-scheme styles
![image](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/15277745/4217bd8b-9ec9-4dce-976f-ced33223be46)

This is what it currently looks like without my own dark-mode. I haven't come around to changing everything to the new css variables (previously sass variables) yet which is why some text is black on black background. Not sure why it compiled in the first place but sometimes angular doesn't pick up on things like this.
![image](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/15277745/8d7756b5-4336-4a5a-9067-993288e23079)

I am sorry if I missed something obvious that could solve my problem.

Issues.Title: 12 columns system not taking full length of container

This is about the Bulma CSS framework
I'm using Bulma [1.0.0]
My browser is: any


### Overview of the problem


The 12 columns system of version 1.0.0 is not taking the full length of its container like it is in version 0.9.4.


### Description

When using column with is-* and the total of the is-* is 12, the columns container does not take 100% of its parent.

In version 0.9.4, the result look like this: (the red line is the end of the parent container)

![screenshot-001260](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/2157261/e980b449-0d64-4b14-8250-5bc61411ee12)

In the screenshots above,  we can notice that the width in version 1.0.0 is using a calculation which is not preset in version 0.9.4.

Issues.Title: Move `sass` to `devDependencies`
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**. It is an optimization/enhancement request.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**, more precisely about the published NPM package.
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** 1.0.0.
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
This issue doesn't seem to be a duplicate.

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->
**TL;DR** Installing `sass` shouldn't be mandatory for developers using only CSS files.

- Bulma v1 is a full rewrite of the framework using [Dart Sass](https://sass-lang.com/dart-sass/).
- `sass` has been added as a dependency of the NPM package (to promote its usage with Bulma v1?), [increasing dramatically the package size](https://packagephobia.com/result?p=bulma).
- Compiled CSS is provided in the NPM package along Sass files, so Sass doesn't seem to be required in order to use Bulma. Even some customization can be done with CSS only (using CSS variables), Sass seems to be required only for advanced usage/customization.
- `sass` dependency could be moved to `devDependencies` in order to reduce the package installation size, developers can still install `sass` when they need to use Bulma Sass files.

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--
1. First Step
2. Second Step
3. and so on...
-->

Install `bulma@1.0.0` NPM package (to use only CSS files).

### Expected behavior

`sass` dependency installation shouldn't be forced when we only want to use Bulma CSS files.

### Actual behavior

`sass` is a dependency of `bulma@1.0.0` and is installed automatically by NPM, even if uneeded.

----

**P.S.** Thanks for your work on the v1, it's great to see that this project is still alive ðŸŽ‰
